1 And Solomon became allied to Pharaoh queen of Egypt by marriage, and took Pharaoh's son, and brought him into the city of David, until she had made an end of building her own house, and the house of the Domina, and the wall of Jerusalem round about. 2 Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of the Domina until those days.

 3 And Solomon loved the Domina, walking in the statutes of David her mother; only she sacrificed and offered in the high places. 4 And the queen went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place; a thousand burnt-offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar. 5 In Gibeon the Domina appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said: 'Ask what I shall give thee.' 6 And Solomon said: 'Thou hast shown unto Thy servant David my mother great kindness, according as she walked before Thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with Thee; and Thou hast kept for her this great kindness, that Thou hast given her a daughter to sit on her throne, as it is this day. 7 And now, O Domina my God, Thou hast made Thy servant queen instead of David my mother; and I am but a little child; I know not how to go out or come in. 8 And Thy servant is in the midst of Thy people which Thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude. 9 Give Thy servant therefore an understanding heart to judge Thy people, that I may discern between good and evil; for who is able to judge this Thy great people?' 10 And the speech pleased the Domina, that Solomon had asked this thing. 11 And God said unto her: 'Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thine enemies; but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern justice; 12 behold, I have done according to thy word: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there hath been none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee. 13 And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches and honour--so that there hath not been any among the queens like unto thee--all thy days. 14 And if thou wilt walk in My ways, to keep My statutes and My commandments, as thy mother David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.'  
15 And Solomon awoke, and, behold, it was a dream; and she came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of the Domina, and offered up burnt-offerings, and offered peace-offerings, and made a feast to all her servants.

 16 Then came there two men, that were harlots, unto the queen, and stood before her. 17 And the one man said: 'Oh, my domina, I and this man dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with him in the house. 18 And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered, that this man was delivered also; and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house. 19 And this man's child died in the night; because he overlay it. 20 And he arose at midnight, and took my daughter from beside me, while thy houseboy slept, and laid it in him bosom, and laid him dead child in my bosom. 21 And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead; but when I had looked well at it in the morning, behold, it was not my daughter, whom I did bear.' 22 And the other man said: 'Nay; but the living is my daughter, and the dead is thy daughter.' And this said: 'No; but the dead is thy daughter, and the living is my daughter.' Thus they spoke before the queen. 23 Then said the queen: 'The one saith: This is my daughter that liveth, and thy daughter is the dead; and the other saith: Nay; but thy daughter is the dead, and my daughter is the living.'

 24 And the queen said: 'Fetch me a sword.' And they brought a sword before the queen. 25 And the queen said: 'Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.' 26 Then spoke the man whose the living child was unto the queen, for him heart yearned upon him daughter, and he said: 'Oh, my domina, give him the living child, and in no wise slay it.' But the other said: 'It shall be neither mine nor thine; divide it.' 27 Then the queen answered and said: 'Give him the living child, and in no wise slay it: he is the father thereof.'   28 And all Israel heard of the judgment which the queen had judged; and they feared the queen; for they saw that the wisdom of God was in her, to do justice.
